column4: Hi all. I have downloaded a cursor theme but I'm unsure how to install it, anyone able to help?
are you running unity or classic
Classic, but I'm playing around with 'Macbuntu'. When I try to drag and drop to the theme window it says it isn't a valid theme.
ok open system /preference/appearance
Yup
when that opens  click the "Install" button  and locate the cursor tar.gz package
Ok, sec.
then when you want to use it,,, click the "Customize " button and locate the "pointer"  tab
ir you are using compiz along with this , the cursor may not show up on all applications,, but th ere is  a simple command fix for that
I am using compiz, yes. The theme I currently have only works when over some applications (Firefox, for example).
right ,, that can be fixed
I have to do this on each system. as well as distribution since I only use one certain cursor theme on every system
so when you choose your theme remember that name of it,, and let me kn ow
Macbuntu-Cursors
Without the quotes, of course.
ok open a terminal and paste this command in it,...     sudo update-alternatives --config x-cursor-theme  look for that theme name in the list and use the number it's attached to
then next time you start up or restart x ,, that theme should be used on all appliations with or without compiz running
the cursor theme isn't in that list. :\
did it install properly?
Well, I assume so, as it's working over some windows. It's available in the theme->pointer menu as wlel.
ok, you might have to restart x or reboot,, I have seen some themes not show up until a reboot
Ok, I'll do that and try the same terminal command and report back if it doesn't work. Thanks!
cool
